result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrei M Ladron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance to be refunded to poster.

Domestic Violence Counseling or Anger Managment and follow through as deemed appropriate by the Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence by any means.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions, INCLUDING child care and employment.  Commencing forthwith.
Defendant to serve FIRST 60 DAYS.
LAST FOUR MONTHS are to be STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Andrei M Ladron in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy.  

Victim Impact Statement was previously filed including attachments and a thumb drive.
Court directs that the thumb drive be returned to the victim.
However, court will allow the state to play portions of the thumb drive is they choose too.

State played a portion of the thumb drive.
State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Victim presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's Friend presented statements to the court.
Defendant's Daughter presented statements to the court.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  5 Years.
Initial Confinement: 2.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2.5 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation: 3 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Domestic Violence Counseling or Anger Management and follow through as deemed appropriate by the agent.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint or her residence by any means.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME: 
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions, including child care and employment).
Defendant to serve the first 60 Days - Forthwith - Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant can be transfered to the Huber Facility.
Last 4 Months to be Stayed - To be used at the agents discretion.
 
Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Independent presentence report filed by Attorney LaVoy.
Received and filed in court by the State.
Sentencing hearing on October 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Andrei M Ladron in court with attorney Jonathan A. Lavoy. 
Motion filed by Defense - For Suppression.

Atty. Lavoy would like to hold his motion to suppress in abeyance at this time and address a different issue today.
Atty. Lavoy is requesting to subpeona the Victim (defendant's soon to be ex-wife), however, State and divorce attorney are not willing to give them her address in order to subpeona her.
Therefore, defense is request the court order the state to turn over the victim's address and presented arguments to the court.
Victim did appear in court today - Therefore, Defense will subpeona the victim in court with the new motion date.
